dt: {bc}an interrogative expression often used to test knowledge
{bc}a subject or aspect in dispute or open for discussion {bc}{sx|issue||}
{bc}a subject or point of debate or a proposition to be voted on in a meeting
{bc}the bringing of such to a vote

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}quaestion-, quaestio{/it}, from {it}quaerere{/it} to seek, ask
shortdef: an interrogative expression often used to test knowledge
a subject or aspect in dispute or open for discussion : issue; broadly : problem, matter

dt: {bc}to ask a question of or about

pt: {sc}ask{/sc} {sc}question{/sc} {sc}interrogate{/sc} {sc}query{/sc} {sc}inquire{/sc} mean to address a person in order to gain information. {sc}ask{/sc} implies no more than the putting of a question.
{sc}question{/sc} usually suggests the asking of series of questions.

pt.t: {it}questioned{/it} them about every detail of the trip

pt: {sc}interrogate{/sc} suggests formal or official systematic questioning.

pt.t: the prosecutor {it}interrogated{/it} the witness all day

pt: {sc}query{/sc} implies a desire for authoritative information or confirmation.
{sc}inquire{/sc} implies a searching for facts or for truth often specifically by asking questions.

pt.t: began to {it}inquire{/it} of friends and teachers what career she should pursue

shortdef: to ask a question of or about

dt: {bc}someone (such as an athlete) whose condition, talent, or potential for success is in doubt
{bc}a mark ? used in writing and printing at the conclusion of a sentence to indicate a direct question

shortdef: someone (such as an athlete) whose condition, talent, or potential for success is in doubt
a mark ? used in writing and printing at the conclusion of a sentence to indicate a direct question

dt: {bc}a period in a session of a British parliamentary body during which members may put questions to ministers on matters concerning their departments

shortdef: a period in a session of a British parliamentary body during which members may put questions to ministers on matters concerning their departments

dt: {bc}a period of time when people can have their questions answered

dt.t: After the speech there will be a {it}question and answer session{/it}.

shortdef: a period of time when people can have their questions answered

dt: {bc}a person who asks the questions for people to answer on a quiz show

shortdef: a person who asks the questions for people to answer on a quiz show

dt: {bc}an examination question that requires an answer in a sentence, paragraph, or short composition

shortdef: an examination question that requires an answer in a sentence, paragraph, or short composition

dt: {bc}a parliamentary motion to put the pending question to an immediate vote without further debate or amendment that if defeated has the effect of permitting resumption of debate

shortdef: a parliamentary motion to put the pending question to an immediate vote without further debate or amendment that if defeated has the effect of permitting resumption of debate

dt: {bc}a question asked of oneself by oneself

shortdef: a question asked of oneself by oneself
